intro: Rhynchodia, commonly known as the "garden bell" or "Chinese bellflower," is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that can range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Rhynchodia has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy care requirements.
